Package sample

Class RegisterController

java.lang.Object
sample.RegisterController
Direct Known Subclasses:
OrganizationInfoController, PersonalInfoController
public class RegisterController
extends java.lang.Object
This is the Controller Class to handheld the register the Person and the Organizations of the system.

  • Constructor Details

    • RegisterController

      public RegisterController()

  • Method Details

    • getTxtUsername

      public static java.lang.String getTxtUsername()
      Getter function of the Username.
      Returns:
      String, the username.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This is the initializing function of the fxml components. When a the window is launched this method initializes these components. Establishes the connection with the database and upon fetching the data columns works with the property values.

    • checkUserValid

      public boolean checkUserValid()
      Method for checking the validity of the user
      Returns:
      boolean, true if valid user and false otherwise.

    • checkPassword

      public boolean checkPassword()
      Method for checking the Reentered password for confirmations.
      Returns:
      boolean, truth value based on the fact whether two strings match or not.

    • checkAlert

      public boolean checkAlert()
      This method is for checking the Alerts of the total process. The Fetched data from the database ond the user i/p is processed here and in case of any anomaly which may crash the program or create inconsistency, the alert value will be true.
      Returns:
      boolean and the value depends on the truth value of the alert.

    • pressNext

      public void pressNext​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      This is for the first page of Registrations. After the user gives the username, password and type, the next button will be pressed. These information will be written into the database and the next form for details is presented by the sample.PersonalInfo.fxml file.
      Parameters:
      even - object of ActionEvent Class.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • pressBack

      public void pressBack​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      This method is here for the functionality of the "Back" button. This will redirect the user to the parent node that is the "root" which is sample.UserPanel.fxml. This hierarchical structure is for the simplicity of the system.
      Parameters:
      even - , object of ActionEvent generated from click or Enter
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
